definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: South African plant widely cultivated for its showy pure white spathe and yellow spadix.
sentences.chinese: 长有耀眼的纯白色苞和黄色纤维的一种南非种植植物。

sentences.english: You are my fondest wish and my brightest dream.
sentences.chinese: 你是我最钟爱的希望和最耀眼的梦想。
这种蝴蝶简直就是耀眼夺目。

sentences.english: The sun glared out of the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 蓝天上太阳发出耀眼的光芒。

sentences.english: These eye-catching title is the role played by marketing.
sentences.chinese: 这些耀眼的名称的确起到了促销的作用。

sentences.english: In the glare from the street-light, I could see Dill hatching one.
sentences.chinese: 在耀眼的街灯下我看得出迪尔又在打鬼主意。

sentences.english: The brilliant shine dazzling me, I will be the dawn of the star.
sentences.chinese: 耀眼的光辉照耀着我，我将会成为拂晓之星。

sentences.english: The adult Chinese White Dolphin is pink.
sentences.chinese: 成年中华白海豚拥有一身耀眼的粉红色。

sentences.english: The meat dish is the center piece of the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，餐桌上的关键肯定是最耀眼的肉菜了。

sentences.english: Here are eight of the most impressive crowdfunded products at the show.
sentences.chinese: 以下是此次展会中八项最为耀眼的众筹产品。

sentences.english: Historiography in the 20th century's most dazzling star of the Annales school in France.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪史学中最耀眼的新星是法国的年鉴学派。

sentences.english: Light glared from the unshaded bulb.
sentences.chinese: 无罩灯泡发出耀眼的光芒。

sentences.english: Just outside the windows kapok flowers glowed red in full bloom.
sentences.chinese: 窗外的木棉树上开着耀眼的红花。

sentences.english: Safin's younger sister Dinara Safina is also a sensational tennis star of the world.
sentences.chinese: 萨芬的妹妹萨芬娜也是世界网坛一颗耀眼的明星。

sentences.english: Don't want no bright lights, false teeth, doorbells, landlords.
sentences.chinese: 我不想要耀眼的灯光，假牙，门铃，房东。

sentences.english: A false Friend and a Shadow, attend only while the Sun shines.
sentences.chinese: 虚伪的朋友与阴影，只在光芒耀眼时现形。
